--- Page 1 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2020/0016 b) Date of Occurrence: 09/02/2024
c) Installation Details: Wasp Interceptor - AC-8208-455 at
Forward Operating Base-3
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Pneumatic b) Date Component 14/02/2024
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Pneumatic Starter d) Main Assembly: Station-1 Starboard
e) Nomenclature: Pneumatic Starter Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: Standard
g) Part No.: PN-9290-D7 h) Sl No.: SN-5022-595
i) Firmware Version: Not Applicable j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 24/03/2023 l) Date of Removal: 12/02/2024
Pg No: 63 Ln No: 10 Pg No: 144 Ln No: 27
m) Manufacturing Agency: Stellar Avionics Ltd n) Date, Month & Year November 2015
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: No p) Whether under AMC Yes
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 1106 Hrs / 596 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Critical
b) Defect Observed: Pressure regulator drift. Abnormality observed during system test.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Foreign object damage to critical surface
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Pneumatic Starter component. Testing
confirmed performance below acceptable limits.
c) Remedial Measures Conduct detailed inspection of all similar components in fleet
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Introduce protective coating to prevent environmental degradation
d) Attributable Code: N - Not established
Remarks: Investigation completed as per established procedures. All findings documented.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Technical evaluation completed. Proposed preventive measures are appropriate and align with design intent.
Date: 22/02/2024 Authorized Signatory of Design: Dr. P.L. Mehta

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Quality assurance review completed. Recommend enhanced incoming inspection criteria for this component type.
Date: 25/02/2024 Signature: Air Cmde S.B. Rao
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
User feedback incorporated. Recommend enhanced crew training on system operation and limitations.
Date: 26/02/2024 Signature: Sqn Ldr A.R. Desai
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
Quality oversight review completed. Recommend monitoring effectiveness of implemented preventive actions.
Date: 26/02/2024 Signature: Wg Cdr M.S. Reddy
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
Certification review completed. Proposed modifications do not affect type design approval. Acceptable.
Date: 02/03/2024 Signature: Dr. S.M. Kulkarni
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
